translation.ko: 존 미첼이 가족 비서로 매코이를 고용한 거죠 "제임스 W. 매코드 주니어 대통령 재선 위원회 보안국장"

translation.en: John Mitchell comes back from California over to Washington.
translation.ko: "존 딘의 육성 백악관 법률 고문" 존 미첼은 캘리포니아에서 워싱턴으로 돌아왔습니다

translation.en: At that point, he did have a big problem.
translation.ko: 그때 존 미첼에게 큰 문제가 있었습니다

translation.en: He had clearly authorized this bungled burglary.
translation.ko: 그 서투른 도둑질을 명확히 허가한 당사자였던 거죠

translation.en: [newsman] Today, John Mitchell, the chairman of President Nixon's reelection committee,
translation.ko: 닉슨 대통령 재선 위원회의 수장 존 미첼은

translation.en: denied any connection with the incident.
translation.ko: 침입 사건에 연루됐다는 의혹을 오늘 부정했습니다

translation.en: [Martha] Why did they let me go all this time
without knowing about the break-in at Watergate?
Why did they leave me out here in California?
Now, I'm inclined to believe
translation.ko: 이윽고 저는 그 사람들이 워터게이트 때문에

translation.en: that these characters must have gotten me out of Washington
because of Watergate.
I immediately picked up the telephone,
called Washington to find out what it was all about.
I meet with John Mitchell in his apartment.
translation.ko: 존 미첼을 그 사람 아파트에서 만났어요 "존 딘의 육성 백악관 법률 고문"

translation.en: -[phone rings] -There are calls from Martha then.
She was outraged that John had left her in California
translation.ko: 존이 전말을 숨기고 자신을 캘리포니아에 방치했다며

translation.en: and not given her the full story.
All I heard is that Martha was out of hand,
that she had been hysterical.
[Martha] We were in a villa at the hotel.
I'm sitting on the bed, I'm calling Helen Thomas,
and the bodyguard came in.
He said, "Mrs. Mitchell is on the phone with Helen Thomas."
translation.ko: "프레드 러루의 육성 존 미첼의 정치 참모" 미첼 여사가 헬렌 토머스와 통화 중이라고 하더군요

translation.en: "She's telling her a bunch of stuff about Watergate."
"What should I do?"
Pretty soon, I heard her saying, "Get away."
translation.ko: 얼마 지나지 않아 저리 가라고 하는 소리가 들렸어요

translation.en: I didn't know what was happening, and then there was a phone disconnect.
[man] I was a doctor that was on call for the hotel.
I just went to a private room.
translation.ko: "댄 로메인 커컴 박사의 육성" 개인실로 곧장 들어갔죠

translation.en: There were people in the room,
and they were beside themselves about her yelling and screaming.
translation.ko: 소리치고 절규하는 부인 때문에 다들 흥분했습니다

translation.en: They wanted to calm her down.
She was held down, and I did give her an injection, tranquilizer.
translation.ko: 주변에서 부인을 붙잡았고 저는 주사를 놓았습니다 진정제 주사였죠

translation.en: This whole thing was very unusual, right?
But when some high official from the government calls,
well, then you do it.
And that was the beginning of my being held a prisoner.
You really were held a prisoner?
Literally held a prisoner within four walls.
[newsman 1] Following the embarrassing Watergate bugging affair,
Martha Mitchell is talking again. Late yesterday, she told a reporter
translation.ko: 마사 미첼이 다시 입을 열었습니다 어제 늦은 시각에 한 기자에게

translation.en: she'd become a captive of her husband's security guards.
translation.ko: 자신이 남편의 경호원에게 붙잡혀 있었다고 말했습니다

translation.en: When she used the phone, she said, five of them tore it out of the wall,
translation.ko: 자신이 전화를 쓰자 다섯 명이 별안간 나타나더니

translation.en: then, quote, "Threw me down on a bed and stuck a needle in my behind."
translation.ko: 자신을 침대에 내던지고 등에 바늘을 찔러 넣었다고 합니다

translation.en: [Helen Thomas] I don't think there are many women in this country
translation.ko: "마사 미첼 왈 그들은 내가 말하길 원치 않는다" 이 나라에서 전화기에 대고 자기가 정치범으로 잡혀 있다고

translation.en: who call you up and say,
translation.ko: 이 나라에서 전화기에 대고 자기가 정치범으로 잡혀 있다고

translation.en: "Look, I'm being held a political prisoner."
So you did have this feeling that
translation.ko: "마사가 선거 운동을 경찰과 도둑 놀이로 칭하다"

translation.en: there were certain hostile forces.
translation.ko: 그래서 일종의 적대적 세력이 있단 느낌이 들었죠

translation.en: [newsman 1] She displayed bruises on her arms,
translation.ko: "경호원에게 맞았다고 주장하는 미첼 여사" 미첼 여사는 팔에 난 멍을 보여 줬고

translation.en: and she said she had more bruises on her thighs.
She said, quote, "I was a patriot until I got assassinated."
The president got into a number of political things today.
translation.ko: "H.R. 홀드먼의 육성 백악관 비서실장" 오늘 대통령님이 정치적 문제에 많이 엮이셨다

translation.en: His principal concern was the Martha Mitchell question.
translation.ko: 그분의 주요 관심사는 마사 미첼 문제였다

translation.en: The president feels that John's got to close her down somehow
translation.ko: 대통령님은 존이 어떻게든 마사를 만류하거나 가둬야 한다고 생각하신다

translation.en: or lock her up.
That he can't just leave her speaking out like this.
translation.ko: 멋대로 말하게 내버려 둘 순 없기 때문이다

translation.en: It's gonna create a major national problem.
[newsman 2] Martha Mitchell is telling reporters
translation.ko: 마사 미첼은 남편이 정계에서 물러날 때까지

translation.en: she is leaving her husband until he decides to get out of politics.
translation.ko: 마사 미첼은 남편이 정계에서 물러날 때까지 남편을 떠나겠다고 기자들에게 밝혔습니다 "마사의 요구 대통령 아니면 나"

translation.en: She said, "I love my husband very much,
translation.ko: 미첼 여사는 이렇게 말했습니다 '남편을 많이 사랑하지만'

translation.en: but I'm not going to stand for all those dirty things that go on."
translation.ko: '지금 벌어지는 온갖 더러운 일은 참을 수 없습니다'

translation.en: I frankly believe that if it hadn't been for Martha,
John probably wouldn't have let this Watergate thing get out of hand.
translation.ko: 존이 워터게이트 사건을 똑바로 처리했을 거야

translation.en: We've got a lid on it, but it may not stay on,
translation.ko: 홀드먼: 상황을 통제하고 있지만 오래가지 못할 겁니다

translation.en: and his getting out might just be a good move on that.
translation.ko: 존이 사퇴한다면 묘수가 될 수 있습니다

translation.en: The Martha fans will think, "Isn't that a wonderful thing?"
translation.ko: 마사 추종자 무리는 멋진 결정이라고 여기겠죠

translation.en: The man has given up his (job) - you know,
translation.ko: 자기 일을 포기한 남자로 만드는 겁니다

translation.en: it's kind of like the Duke of Windsor
giving up his throne for the woman he loves.
translation.ko: 사랑하는 여인 때문에 왕위를 포기한 에드워드 8세처럼 말입니다

translation.en: The poor woman isn't well and all,
and he's gonna be by her side, and all that.
And we would leak out the fact that she's not well - very strongly. We have to.
translation.ko: 닉슨: 그리고 마사가 아프다는 사실을 강력하게 뿌리는 거야 - 반드시 그래야 해 - 홀드먼: 이미 진행 중입니다

translation.en: We're already doing that.
translation.ko: - 반드시 그래야 해 - 홀드먼: 이미 진행 중입니다

translation.en: [Martha] All of a sudden, these rumors start flying out of the White House.
translation.ko: 갑자기 이런 소문이 백악관에 퍼지기 시작했어요

translation.en: And the first thing I know, it's in print that I'm crazy,
that I'm this, that I'm that.
translation.ko: 이것도 문제고, 저것도 문제고 "정신적으로 문제가 있다"

translation.en: The resignation is going to be a positive story.
translation.ko: 홀드먼: 존이 사퇴하면 긍정적 일화가 될 겁니다

translation.en: It's gonna hang totally on Martha.
I mean, I think you should do it.
Call in the press.
John Mitchell, the former attorney general,
has quit as President Nixon's campaign director.
[male reporter] He told the president that his reason for resigning
translation.ko: "닉슨 곁을 떠나는 애처가 미첼" 그는 부인 때문에 사퇴한다고 대통령에게 밝혔습니다

translation.en: was Mrs. Mitchell.
translation.ko: 그는 부인 때문에 사퇴한다고 대통령에게 밝혔습니다 "내 아내"

translation.en: Some Democrats maintain that the burglary of their headquarters
translation.ko: 일부 민주당원은 미첼 전 장관의 부하 직원이

translation.en: carried out by, among others, a member of Mitchell's staff,
translation.ko: 다른 일당과 민주당 본부에 침입한 것이

translation.en: may have been a factor.
Republicans flatly and vehemently deny this.
They say the one and only reason is Mrs. Mitchell.
translation.ko: 유일한 사퇴 사유는 미첼 여사라고 말합니다

translation.en: A Justice Department friend of the Mitchells said after that, quote,
translation.ko: 미첼 부부와 친분이 있는 법무부 관계자가 말했습니다

translation.en: "Martha has a special problem."
"Obviously, it has gotten more serious," unquote.
[Martha] I was mortified, hurt,
and I didn't know whom had really hurt me.
translation.ko: 제게 상처를 준 게 누군지 잘 몰랐어요

translation.en: I think the California incident was kind of the beginning.
That's when she realized
that, for whatever reason, she was being silenced.
translation.ko: 이유가 어찌 됐든 누군가 입막음한다는 것을요

translation.en: Martha Mitchell has ended up
describing herself as a political prisoner.
I think that all of us have some obligation to free Martha Mitchell.
translation.ko: 우리 모두 마사 미첼을 해방할 의무가 있다고 생각합니다 "조지 맥거번 1972년 민주당 대선 후보"

translation.en: [crowd chanting] Free Martha Mitchell!
Free Martha Mitchell!
translation.ko: 마사 미첼을 석방하라! "마사 미첼에게 치킨 수프가 필요해"

translation.en: -[woman] Come on! -[crowd] Free Martha Mitchell! Free Martha Mitchell!
The story of how she was held against her will
translation.ko: 마사가 본인 의지와 상관없이 억류된 이야기는

translation.en: seemed so fanciful.
Did people really believe her?
translation.ko: "계속되는 마사 미첼 이야기" 사람들이 정말 마사를 믿었을까요?

translation.en: I doubt anybody did.
[Martha] I'm staying in my own little apartment,
hiding because I am so embarrassed.
I just completely resigned myself from politics
translation.ko: "마사의 파티가 끝나다" 저는 정계에서 완전히 물러났어요

translation.en: while they were trying every way under the sun
translation.ko: 반면에 그 사람들은 워터게이트 사건을 무마하려고

translation.en: to get Watergate out of the way.
Watergate was not just a burglary, by any means.
translation.ko: "밥 우드워드의 육성 워싱턴포스트 소속 언론인" 여러모로 봐도 워터게이트는 단순한 침입 사건이 아니었어요

translation.en: What Watergate was, was a massive campaign
that played dirty tricks on people to win reelection.
translation.ko: 사람들에게 더러운 수작을 부린 대규모 선거 운동이었죠

translation.en: It was the mad scramble to cover up and conceal,
as much as possible, at least until the '72 election.
[crowd chanting] Four more years!
[Bob Woodward] And it succeeded.
Nixon won by a landslide.
Hate was the theme of his presidency.
Let's use the power of the presidency as an instrument of revenge
translation.ko: 대통령의 권력을 이용해서 앞길을 막는 자들에게

translation.en: against anyone who was in his way,
including Martha Mitchell.
With the election, the Watergate story dried up
translation.ko: "젭 매그루더의 육성 대통령 재선 위원회 부국장" 워터게이트 사건은 선거와 함께 시들해지고

translation.en: and went to bed basically.
And it wasn't resurrected until McCord.
[male reporter 1] James McCord, the man who told the judge
that there was a lot more to be said about the Watergate case,
translation.ko: 워터게이트 사건에 대해 할 말이 많다고 했으며

translation.en: today went before a Senate committee to tell what he knows.
translation.ko: 오늘 자신이 아는 바를 말하고자 상원 위원회에 출석했습니다

translation.en: [male reporter 2] McCord had said John Mitchell had advanced knowledge of Watergate.
translation.ko: 존 미첼이 워터게이트에 관해 잘 알고 있다고 했습니다

translation.en: Mr. Mitchell, you were once virtually a symbol of law and order--
translation.ko: 미첼 전 장관님은 한때 법과 질서의 상징이셨는데요

translation.en: I still am. You better believe it.
John Mitchell is out of the administration at that point.
translation.ko: 존 미첼은 그 시점에 행정부 사람이 아니었습니다

translation.en: He's a private citizen.
But Martha started talking to friends in the press.
translation.ko: 하지만 마사는 언론계 친구에게 입을 열기 시작했습니다

translation.en: Fred LaRue told me to be careful when calling
translation.ko: 프레드 러루가 전화할 때 조심하라고 제게 말했습니다

translation.en: because Martha picked up the phone and would listen in.
So be very careful what you say.
Did you see what Martha Mitchell did?
translation.ko: 홀드먼: 마사 미첼이 뭘 했는지 아십니까?

translation.en: No. Did she call somebody?
She called The New York Times.
And told them what?
She went through a whole thing of, "They're framing John,
and I'm not gonna let them do it."
She says, "They're not gonna pin anything on him."
"I won't let them, and I don't give a damn who gets hurt."
translation.ko: 자기가 막을 것이고 누가 다치든 상관없으며

translation.en: "I can name names."
I think she was angry at Nixon for putting John in this whole situation.
translation.ko: 존을 이런 상황에 빠뜨린 닉슨에게 분노한 것 같아요

translation.en: She wanted to protect John,
but I don't think she knew how involved John really was.
translation.ko: 존이 얼마나 연루됐는지 몰랐던 것 같아요

translation.en: I think her love for John was her blindside.
translation.ko: 존에 대한 사랑에 눈이 멀었나 봐요

translation.en: I am sick and tired of people saying I'm after publicity.
translation.ko: 제가 관심을 구걸한다는 말에 질리고 신물이 나요

translation.en: But if I have to get publicity in order to clear two guiltless people,
translation.ko: 하지만 무고한 두 사람을 위해 관심을 얻어야 해요

translation.en: my husband and myself--
And you can place all the blame right on the White House.
[male reporter] What do you mean "on the White House"?
What do I mean "on the White House"?
[male reporter] The blame on the White House.
Well, where do you think all of this originated?
Do you think my husband's that stupid?
And whom do you think he's been protecting?
Whom?
[male reporter] I have no idea. Who?
Mr. President, he has been protecting,
under no uncertain circumstances.
I'll tell them all. And you know what they're gonna do,
translation.ko: 다 말할 거예요 그 사람들이 할 짓을 알잖아요

translation.en: they'll probably end up killing me.
But I depend on you, the press, to protect me.
translation.ko: 하지만 저는 언론에 의지하고 있어요 저를 지켜 주세요

translation.en: [Helen Thomas] I was in Madison, Wisconsin, and she tracked me down.
translation.ko: 위스콘신주 매디슨에 있었는데 마사가 어렵게 찾아와서는

translation.en: And then she said Nixon should resign.
She was the first to say so.
translation.ko: 그 말을 꺼낸 건 마사가 처음이었어요

translation.en: The wife of the former Nixon campaign manager
said her husband and the president spent many evenings planning strategy.
translation.ko: 남편과 대통령이 오랜 기간 전략을 짰다고 밝혔습니다

translation.en: And in Mrs. Mitchell's words,
"Mr. President always knew what was going on."
Here is a president telling we Americans
translation.ko: 대통령이라는 사람이 우리 미국 국민에게 이렇게 말해요

translation.en: he doesn't know about all these horrible things
translation.ko: 자기 코앞에서 벌어진 온갖 끔찍한 일을

translation.en: that are happening underneath his nose?
This man knew what was going on,
translation.ko: 이 사람은 무슨 일이 벌어지는지 알고 있었어요

translation.en: or he was negligent in being president.
translation.ko: 그게 아니라면 대통령 직무에 태만했던 거죠

translation.en: [Bob Woodward] She smelled it.
She knew something dirty was going on.
translation.ko: "마사 왈, 닉슨은 다 알고 있다" 뭔가 더러운 일이 돌아가는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: Carl Bernstein and I started to realize she was a Greek chorus of one,
translation.ko: 칼 번스틴과 저는 마사가 옳은 말을 한다는 걸 깨달았습니다

translation.en: because she was telling the truth.
When you're married to someone who's in serious legal trouble,
like John Mitchell was, you know.
translation.ko: 문제 있는 사람과 결혼하면 알게 되지요

translation.en: [Martha] The only thing that John Mitchell got mad about
was when I said that I thought that Mr. President should resign.
translation.ko: 제가 대통령이 사임해야 한다고 말했을 때뿐이었어요

translation.en: And I think perhaps he got a little backtalk from the White House.
translation.ko: 백악관에서 좀 험한 말을 들었나 봐요

translation.en: Martha told John Mitchell,
"If you stick with Nixon, you're going to jail."
translation.ko: '닉슨과 붙어 다니면 당신은 감옥 가는 거야'

translation.en: "And the man who caused it all is going free."
[newsman] Former Attorney General John Mitchell has left his wife
translation.ko: 존 미첼 전 법무부 장관이 부인과 떨어져서

translation.en: and has moved into a New York hotel.
Newsweek says this is the result of a recent series of violent outbursts
in which Mrs. Mitchell threw her husband's clothes
into the hall of their apartment building.
Friends claim Mitchell has told them his wife is a sick woman,
translation.ko: 주변인에 따르면 미첼 전 장관은 부인이 아픈 사람이라고 했지만

translation.en: but that he cannot bring himself to take the legal steps necessary
translation.ko: 부인을 입원시키는 데 필요한 법적 조치는

translation.en: to have her committed.
She was by herself after he left.
translation.ko: "파이퍼 댕크워스의 육성" 남편이 떠나고 마사는 홀로 남았어요

translation.en: Her daughter, Marty, wasn't there.
And I know that when they were estranged, that was a hole in Martha's heart.
translation.ko: 가족끼리 소원해졌을 때 마사의 마음이 찢어진 걸 저는 알아요

translation.en: I've been under the most trying things,
and if anybody could turn out to be an alcoholic, I should.
translation.ko: 이 정도면 알코올에 중독될 만도 하죠

translation.en: But I'm not.
[Piper Dankworth] I think she was scared all the time that something else might happen to her.
translation.ko: 마사는 다른 일이 생길까 봐 늘 겁냈던 것 같아요

translation.en: She said, "I know they're doing this because they think I know too much."
translation.ko: 자기가 너무 많이 알아서 당하는 일이라고 했죠

translation.en: [Martha] I have been doped.
They've tried to put me in the mental institution twice.
translation.ko: 그 사람들은 저를 두 번이나 정신병원에 보내려 했어요

translation.en: They've tried to kill me.
I was scared to death.
Because every day, I wake up and I think, "What's gonna happen today?"
translation.ko: 매일 아침 일어나면 이런 생각이 들었어요 '오늘은 무슨 일이 생길까?'

translation.en: I don't know why I didn't realize, to some extent,
what was going on, but I didn't.
…until I found out
Richard Nixon and Mitchell sat in the Oval Office
and planned all this mess on me.
translation.ko: 나에 대한 음모를 꾸민 걸 알기 전까지는요

translation.en: It was in the tapes.
It was only last week that the Senate Watergate Committee
learned of the existence of tape recordings
of President Nixon's conversations,
including conversations bearing on Watergate.
John Mitchell, as I thought, resigned because of me,
translation.ko: 저 때문에 존 미첼이 사임했다고 생각했는데

translation.en: but the tapes say, to the contrary,
that he and Richard Nixon controlled me,
translation.ko: 존 미첼과 리처드 닉슨이 저를 조종해서

translation.en: and therefore they had planned
exactly how Mitchell would get out of the campaign.
translation.ko: 미첼이 선대위에서 빠져나갈 계획을 모색한 거예요

translation.en: She (Martha) really went over the brink this time around.
translation.ko: 존 미첼: 이번에는 마사가 정말로 아슬아슬한 상황에 처했습니다

translation.en: We've created something of a Frankenstein with the press, you know.
translation.ko: 우리가 언론과 함께 일종의 괴물을 만든 겁니다

translation.en: She's a-- She's a celebrity.
That is correct.
I can try to keep a lid on it and keep things quiet.
translation.ko: 제가 잘 덮어서 조용히 처리할 수 있습니다

translation.en: With you taking this move (resignation), it will be a surprise.
translation.ko: 홀드먼: 위원장님이 사퇴하시면 깜짝 소식이 될 겁니다

translation.en: Otherwise…
You're right, it will be tied right into Watergate.
Nixon's closest political associates
were placed under criminal indictment today
in a climactic moment for the long Watergate investigation.
[male reporter] John Mitchell, former attorney general and campaign director,
translation.ko: 전 법무부 장관이자 선대위원장인 존 미첼은

translation.en: now charged with obstruction of justice, lying to the grand jury and the FBI,
translation.ko: 공무집행방해와 배심원단 및 FBI에 대한 위증으로

translation.en: faces 30 years in prison.
[woman] I'm sure Mitchell thought he was gonna get a pardon,
but then, of course, Nixon left without pardoning him.
translation.ko: 닉슨은 사면해 주지 않고 퇴임했지요 "윈졸라 맥렌던 언론인"

translation.en: [Nixon] Throughout the long and difficult period of Watergate,
I have felt it was my duty to persevere.
However, it has become evident to me
that I no longer have a strong enough political base in the Congress.
translation.ko: 확고한 정치적 기반을 잃은 것이 명확해졌습니다

translation.en: I shall resign the presidency effective at noon tomorrow.
translation.ko: 저는 내일 정오를 기해 대통령직을 사임할 것입니다

translation.en: [Martha] The night that Nixon resigned
was the first time I really felt the whole thing.
And that was the beginning of I had to stand up.
[newswoman] There was a time people thought
that Martha Mitchell was amusing and outrageous,
translation.ko: 우스꽝스럽고 별난 사람으로 치부한 시절이 있었습니다

translation.en: with her outspoken opinions and midnight telephone calls.
translation.ko: 직설적인 견해와 심야에 전화하는 습관 때문이었죠

translation.en: Then came her frank angry statements on the Watergate,
translation.ko: 그 뒤에 솔직하고 노여운 어조로 워터게이트 사건을 비판하자

translation.en: and the chilling realization that Martha Mitchell was telling the truth.
translation.ko: 마사 미첼이 진실을 말했다는 냉엄한 현실이 드러났습니다

translation.en: Welcome to Panorama. I'm Maury Povich.
And would you please welcome our co-host this week, Martha Mitchell.
translation.ko: 이번 주 공동 진행자 마사 미첼을 환영해 주세요

translation.en: The White House was telling reporters such as myself,
John Mitchell was resigning
because he had to go take care of his wife who had flipped.
translation.ko: 정신적으로 힘든 아내를 돌보는 것이라고 했어요

translation.en: -Poor John had to take care of me. -That's right.
translation.ko: - 불쌍한 존이 절 돌봐야 했군요 - 맞아요

translation.en: People say you started the whole Watergate thing.
-You let everybody know. -That's absolutely right.
-Are you happy with the outcome? -Thank you-- I am indeed.
[male reporter] Do you think that if President--
It's been the greatest thing in the world for this country.
translation.ko: 이 나라에 일어난 세계 최고의 사건이었어요

translation.en: We're going to get all the politicians
real true blue again.
They're not going to be dishonest.
The men who were closest to Richard Nixon, in the White House and in politics,
today were sentenced to prison for their role in the Watergate cover-up.
translation.ko: 워터게이트 사건에 가담한 죄로 오늘 징역형을 선고받았습니다

translation.en: [male reporter] For many people, it was the grand finale of the Watergate drama.
translation.ko: 많은 이가 보기에 워터게이트 드라마의 대단원입니다

translation.en: Afterward, John Mitchell had a comment.
translation.ko: 존 미첼은 선고 후에 소감을 밝혔습니다

translation.en: It could've been a lot worse.
He might've sentenced me to live with Martha Mitchell,
translation.ko: 마사 미첼과 사는 것보다는 덜 가혹하니까요

translation.en: so I think I'm on the plus side since then.
[male reporter] Are you bitter at all about this? Extremely so.
[male reporter 1] Martha Mitchell,
a lady who has been famous for dispensing much talk at the White House,
has taken up selling dresses at the Pink House.
translation.ko: 핑크 하우스에서 드레스 파는 일을 시작했습니다

translation.en: [male reporter 2] She sued John Mitchell for overdue support payments,
and within the last two weeks, a court document described her
translation.ko: 최근 2주 안에 작성된 법원 문서에 따르면

translation.en: as desperately ill, without funds and without friends.
translation.ko: 돈도 친구도 없이 투병 생활을 하고 있습니다 "마사 미첼이 악성 혈액 질환을 앓다"

translation.en: [Winzola McLendon] When she got sick, she didn't wanna see a lot of her friends.
translation.ko: 마사는 아플 때 친구 보는 것을 싫어했어요

translation.en: The one person who she did wanna see, refused to see her.
translation.ko: 마사가 보고 싶던 유일한 사람은 만남을 거부했지요

translation.en: [male reporter] About 400 people in Pine Bluff, Arkansas, turned out this morning
to pay their final respects to Martha Mitchell.
Her candor got her in trouble with the Nixon administration
translation.ko: 고인은 솔직한 성격 때문에 닉슨 행정부는 물론이고

translation.en: and with her own husband.
But it earned her many admirers back at home.
translation.ko: 하지만 많은 추종자가 고인의 고향을 찾았습니다

translation.en: Some of them sent flowers.
One arrangement in white chrysanthemums spelled out this message,
translation.ko: 어느 흰 국화 화환에는 이렇게 적혀 있습니다

translation.en: "Martha was right."
There was no card.
[woman 1] Was she a crazy lady?
I certainly don't think so. I think that she was a terrific person,
translation.ko: 그런 사람은 확실히 아니었어요 멋진 사람이었다고 생각해요

translation.en: and I think she was a visionary in a sense.
Prophetic.
[woman 2] Mrs. Mitchell, you're certainly going to appear
in the history books here and there.
How would you like people to think of you?
translation.ko: 사람들 기억에 어떻게 남길 바라세요? "음성 기록 발췌, '투데이' NBC, 1971년 2월 11일"

translation.en: [Martha] Well, if I ever do any good, Barbara,
translation.ko: 바버라 씨, 제가 잘한 일이 하나라도 있다면

translation.en: I would like to go down as doing some good for my country, that's all.
translation.ko: 나라에 좋은 일을 한 사람으로 남고 싶어요

translation.en: That would be the greatest thrill in the world.
translation.ko: 그러면 세상에서 제일 짜릿한 일이 될 거예요

translation.en: [woman 2] And your way of doing it is to speak out.
translation.ko: - 당신은 목소리를 내서 이뤄냈죠 - 바로 그거예요
